definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Someone's been rifling through my drawers, there's some money missing.
sentences.chinese: 有人翻过我的抽屉，一些钱不见了。

sentences.english: His field has been hacked after harvest.
sentences.chinese: 收获之后他的田地已经翻过了。

sentences.english: Since he’s the past,why not turn over this page?
sentences.chinese: 既然他已经是过去了，为什么不翻过这一页呢？

sentences.english: As he clambered over the railings he grinned at Manuel.
sentences.chinese: 在他攀爬翻过围栏时他对曼纽尔咧嘴笑了笑。

sentences.english: "As soon as we rolled him over, he gasped and started crying, " Harmon says.
sentences.chinese: “我们把他翻过来，他一边喘气一边哭”哈蒙说。

sentences.english: Fry the steak for five minutes and then turn it and fry the other side.
sentences.chinese: 把牛排煎五分钟，然后翻过来再煎另一面。

sentences.english: Someone's turned the chest out alow and aloft.
sentences.chinese: 有人把箱子上上下下都翻过了。

sentences.english: We have turned the page from this black internal divi-sion.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经把内部分裂这黑暗的一页翻过去了。

sentences.english: When it turns over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 当它把一片刚落的叶子吹翻过来时。

sentences.english: Turn the patient over onto his front.
sentences.chinese: 把病人翻过去让他俯卧。

sentences.english: The burglar jumped over a neighboring garden wall and disappeared in the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 那个窃贼从邻居花园的墙头翻过去，消失在黑暗中。

sentences.english: 'You can't keep flipping the cushions every time a new person comes along,' he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说，你总不能在每次来新人的时候都把椅垫翻过来。

sentences.english: Panting, Harry fell forwards over the hydrangea bush, straightened up and stared around.
sentences.chinese: 哈利气喘着向前翻过八仙花灌木，站直并往周围看着。

sentences.english: The wind turned my umbrella inside out .
sentences.chinese: 风把我的伞吹得翻过去了。

sentences.english: As he turns it over, he discovers that one end is loose.
sentences.chinese: 他将念珠翻过来看时，发现其中一端松动了。

definition: to cross over/to transcend/to cover distance/to overcome/to rise above
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up
to climb over/to get over (difficulties)/to scale/to surmount
Dashan, stage name of Canadian Mark Henry Rowswell (1965-), actor and well-known TV personality in PRC
to climb/to pull oneself up/to clamber/to scale/fig. to forge ahead in the face of hardships and danger
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to turn back/to retrace one's steps
